journal-title-group.journal-title: Quarterly Journal of Business and Economics

publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

title-group.article-title: The Dividend Puzzle: A Progress Report

abstract.p: This paper reviews the major theoretical and empirical contributions to the dividend literature since Black reported on the state of knowledge in 1976. In these studies, two major questions emerge that are critical to understanding the dividend puzzle and justifiably receive the majority of the attention. These questions are: 1. What are the tax effects of dividends; and 2. What are the information effects of dividends? Recent developments in dividend signalling models also are discussed.
